title: The challenge of surtitling at the Avignon Festival
French serial rapist midwife shattered his victims' intimacy
subhead: Lionel Charvin, a midwife already convicted for numerous rapes of his patients, is appearing once again before a criminal court starting Thursday for additional crimes, allegedly committed in the same serial pattern.

title: Giorgio Armani, one of the makers of modern fashion, is dead
European and Ukrainian leaders call Trump after summit on ceasefire security guarantees
Europe is now Ukraine's main source of military support
subhead: According to Germany's Kiel Institute, Europeans have provided approximately $95 billion in military aid to Kyiv, compared with $75 billion from Washington. Most of the weapons, however, continue to be manufactured in the United States.

title: Lisbon's Gloria funicular derails, plunging the city into mourning
subhead: While awaiting the results of the investigation, the mayor of the Portuguese capital has ordered the immediate suspension of all other funiculars in the city for technical inspections. The French Ministry of Foreign Affairs announced that a French national was among the injured.

title: French ceramics museum struck by €9.5 million porcelain heist
subhead: The Adrien-Dubouché National Museum in central Limoges, which claims to have the largest collection of porcelain in the world, was burgled on Wednesday night, with three pieces classified as national treasures taken by thieves.

title: 'Block Everything': Anger in France is deep, but mass strikes appear unlikely
subhead: The choice of a Wednesday for the planned September 10 protests raises questions about who has the option to strike, especially as labor disputes in French workplaces have been particularly rare in recent years.

title: In Thiers, in central France, Le Creux de l'Enfer transforms its industrial past into an artistic haven
After years on the sidelines, France's Socialists are having a moment
subhead: Prime Minister François Bayrou's impending downfall stems from his inability to win over the Socialists. They now face a difficult choice between finding an agreement with Macron's coalition or maintaining a stance of radical opposition, observes Le Monde columnist Françoise Fressoz.

title: Julia Kristeva, psychoanalyst and writer: 'The Trumpist deal is the complete absence of the social contract'
subhead: 'May '68 Thinkers Reflect On Trump Era (4/6). The author analyzes the current political climate, shaped by the ambitions of American and Russian leaders, but also by 'woke-ism' and a 'national depression.'

title: Pierpaolo Piccioli and the power of color
subhead: 'Essence of a Style' (1/6). Appointed to the helm of some of the biggest fashion houses, six designers are set to command the industry's attention this season. We look back at what has defined their distinctive touch so far, before their trial by fire. First up, the former creative director of Valentino, who has moved to Balenciaga.
